articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Parisa Hafezi, Jana Choukeir
articles.description: An Israeli military official said 50 Israeli jets had struck around 20 targets in Tehran overnight.
articles.title: Thousands of Iranians flee Tehran bombing; Trump said to consider joining Israel in strikes

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli gunfire and strikes killed at least 30 people across the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, local health authorities said, as some Palestinians there said their plight was being forgotten as attention shifted to the air war between Israel and Iran.
articles.title: Israeli fire kills 30 in Gaza, medics say, as attention shifts to Iran

articles.author: David Ljunggren, John Irish, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will on Tuesday urge the Group of Seven to provide more backing for the war against Russia even after U.S. President Donald Trump left the summit early due to developments in the Middle East.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy to seek G7 support as Trump's early exit puts dampener on summit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The law is an attempt to ease a demographic crisis caused by Russia's war and to enhance ties with Ukraine's diaspora.
articles.title: Parliament passes law to allow multiple citizenship for Ukrainians

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Vatican on Wednesday unveiled a fundraising video centred on newly elected Pope Leo, urging the faithful to support his mission amid a serious financial crisis for the Catholic Church.
articles.title: Cash-strapped Vatican unveils fundraising video centred on Pope Leo

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Austria plans to tighten its gun control rules after a 21-year-old killed 10 people then killed himself in the country's worst school shooting by far, the conservative-led government said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Austria plans to tighten gun control rules after school shooting

articles.author: Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: The United Nations trade and development agency, tasked with helping developing countries access the global economy, faces "painful" cuts as part of broader reforms prompted by a decline in global donor funding, its secretary general said.
articles.title: UN trade agency says it faces 'painful' cuts as countries navigate tariffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A man shot at point blank range by a Kenyan police officer during protests in the capital Nairobi against extrajudicial killings by security forces is alive but in intensive care, his father said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Man shot by Kenyan police during protests is in intensive care, father says

articles.author: Pietro Lombardi
articles.description: Spanish grid operator Redeia disputed the findings of a government report that said failure by the operator to calculate the correct mix of energy was one of the factors that led to a massive blackout in Spain and Portugal on April 28.
articles.title: Spain's grid operator disputes miscalculation in blackout report

articles.author: Chayut Setboonsarng, Chantha Lach
articles.description: Thousands of Cambodians joined a state-organised march in its capital on Wednesday to support the government in an ongoing border dispute with Thailand triggered by the death of a Cambodian soldier last month.
articles.title: Thousands of Cambodians join government rally as border dispute with Thailand intensifies
